Reviews.Title: “Rude Direct TV people are always at this location!!”
Reviews.Author: horsetastic
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta used to be fine until, direct tv convention took over! They are always there now, parked in the parking lot every night. I had a couple of days to kill before I moved into my apartment and I had a pleasant stay a year prior. This time, all hell broke loose the two nights I was there. Several drunk dierct tv guys really caused a lot of problems. One kept me up all night screaming at the poor front desk clerk (who was obviously scared to death of this jerk) and punching walls/ breaking beer bottles. Another guy thought he could "get a massage in my room" ....because he held the door for me. I spent all night wishing I could go get in the pool and hot tub. Honestly, I didn't leave my room until the morning because I thought any of them could be rapists. They were highly drunk and inappropriate. I do not recommend this location, especially if you are a single woman. Staff is super friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NileCruiser
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this La Quinta twice over the past year for a total of 9 days while visiting friends and family. We've not experienced any problems and will definitely stay here again. The staff is a definite asset. On our last visit we failed to check the closet in our room and left behind several pieces of clothing. The very helpful staff rescued our clothes and mailed them back to us the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great price clean frienfly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsCregan
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night last minute booking needed a chain style hotel close by for a reasonable price. on arrival parking was easy for the cars were safe. check.in was friendly and quick too. just to let you know they need the credit card presented at checkin if booked online. i requested a quiet room and was givin a room at the back of the hotel away from the freeway. the room had two doubles and a flat screen tv. it was extremely clean apart from the blanket which had hairs on it :-( the room had lots of nice extras too like hairdryer free toilettries microwave fridge coffee maker. there is also vending machines and ice on each floor. breakfast was good better than expected juices coffee cereals doughnuts muffins waffles yoghurts all you need. the staff were nice and kept the area clean tidy and well stocked. reception were very helpful. there are leaflets for tourists and a pc printer etc to use in the lobby. there is free wifi.in the rooms too. a good cheap deal

Reviews.Title: “Great shuttle, that's it.”
Reviews.Author: lalasoupy
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel and outdated rooms. Not really close to anything but the mall, which you still can't walk to. The saving grace for this hotel is its staff and their shuttle. They will take you anywhere within a five mile radius until 8:30p

Reviews.Title: “Cockaroaches!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana M
Reviews.Content: I was not happy with my stay at all! The room did not smell clean at all. I got a strong smell of urine from the carpet. The room phone did not work. But worst of all, I saw a total of 3 cockaroaches on my short stay! I was so grossed out we checked out immediately! I do not recommend at all....and yes, the noise is pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDShell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Quinta for two nights and was very impressed with the property overall. Parking lot was a bit crowded but we always found a spot. Nicely furnished rooms with comfortable beds. Complimentary breakfast was good for a quick meal - waffles available if you wanted to take a bit longer. Having only one elevator made for some long waits. One note - their rollaway bed was very comfortable. There is a $10 per night charge but definitely worth more than that. A bad rollaway makes for a bad following day, but this rollaway was as comfortable as a normal bed. Sometimes it is the little things that we appreciate most.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: holly h
Reviews.Content: I was surprised this was as nice as it is because I have heard so many unflattering things about the chain. I would absolutely stay here again. The room was clean, the carpet was a little worn, but everything was in good condition. Breakfast buffet was nice, lots of things to choose from. I had yogurt, coffee, and a muffin. The front desk staff was very pleasant and friendly. The only issue was the elevator broke and I had to carry my bag down 5 flights. Otherwise, this was a nice hotel and I would recommend it to a traveler on a budget. Coffee maker and fridge in the room, the bathroom was big, the desk was roomy and nice. Lots of pillows. The room faced the highway and was a little loud, but after about 5 minutes, I didn't notice it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: 22explorer22
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy at this motel, but a very pleasant staff and clean, functional rooms. The swimming pool was great in the morning before the shade disappeared. Breakfast fairly standard cold items plus make-your-own-waffles. Location close to North Park and other North Dallas locations--nice part of town. Quiet on the sixth floor, also. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: horatio3
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable nice and cozy and within walking distance of shops loved the stay great staff had a business meeting in conference center served free breakfast very very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied stay for 24 hours”
Reviews.Author: mbtran321
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel. Right off the hiway which was tricky if you missed the entrance to the hotel.If you did you would have to do a U-turn, other than that it is not bad at all. Clean place. Overslept and missed the buffet in a.m. They had Ethernet cables for you to use if you forgot to bring one. Best prices and accommodations if you do not want super fancy/luxurious plays etc. Business center was useful as well. Room was clean, very comfy beds, and clean bathroom overall. Arrived at 3pm Sat, and checked out Sunday 1030am

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: MrT927
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a safe location from what I could tell. There was a security guard parked in the lot on saturday night when we arrived. The hotel was new and was a typical quality La Quinta. The free breakfast was good as it is at other La Quintas (kolaches, waffles, bagels, muffins, cereal . . .). The only complaint that I had was not with the staff. The doors are angled towards each other and seem to transmit a lot of noise when being closed. Of course it didn't help that I had someone with possibly a psychological disorder that was leaving and entering his room every 15 minutes during the night. While in his room he would yell profanities and would storm out of his room periodically and let the door slam shut (the doors close very hard). I asked to be given a different room, but the clerk called the man and asked that he calm down. Well he did calm down somewhat but he still kept me up for another 30 minutes. I finally fell asleep and asked to moved again to a different floor and the staff obliged - thankfully. We stayed for 5 consecutive nights and all other nights were fine.

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: eggwhite
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked on weekend of Texas - Oklahoma football game and their fans filled the hotel but were not noisy at all. We booked the king suite which was very roomy with comfortable bed, plenty of pillows, quiet and clean. Breakfast was as described in other reviews and varied. Hotel access was easy due to location; staff were courteous and helpful. We visited with relatives in the large suite which was very accommodating for that purpose. Wi-Fi was useful in our room. We had a quiet comfortable night's sleep. What more could we ask? Well, maybe some luggage racks for suitcases...

Reviews.Title: “So clean and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: frugalkk
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta was soo clean. All the furniture looked new. There was no "hotel smell". The desk person was nice. The free internet was great. The continental breakfast was healthy-not just muffins and juice. There was a waffle station. The breakfast included cereal, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, muffins, juice, milk, coffee, fruit, kolaches. It is next to interstate 75 so there is freeway noise but nothing that would disturb your sleep and nothing that earplugs couldn't block out. It is less than 10 minutes from a shopping mall (Dillards, Macys, Nordstroms) and a variety of restaurants for all price ranges. I would highly recommend this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Affordable, Clean and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: foodisourpassion
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we have been to this hotel in the past 12 months. The hotel is located very close to Malls, SMU and the major N-S freeway. During the time that we were there the hotel was inundated by "Ike" refugees (and their dogs) from Houston. The staff was contiually being challenged by balancing the needs of those who had no idea as to when they would be leaving and those of us on more specific plans. The staff was very courteous, the WIFI worked great and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: TGHouston
Reviews.Content: Fine service (friendly and helpful), internet, free breakfast, rooms, pool, and hot tub. Very convenient location. But some extremely annoying frustrations. Card keys constantly stopped working. Had to get new keys 5 times in a 2 night stay. Only 1 very slow elevator for a 7 story hotel (many people give up and use stairs). Fitness center: single recumbent exercise cycle falling apart, with constant shorting out and resetting. Rooms with 2 beds are only full size (not queen), which is very cramped for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: LRtraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas occasionally on business, but usually stay at more expensive properties. However, I was only in town for one night this time and needed a quick in-out, centrally located hotel. In my opinion, this LaQuinta is a great value. Yes, you get what you pay for---the bed could have been a little more firm and there could have been a few more pillows. But what really made the difference for me was attitude. You should expect the front desk to be friendly and accommodating, but everyone from the breakfast attendant to housekeeping (!) went out of their way to be friendly and hospitable. If you stay anywhere at all in any property, you will realize how rare and valuable that is these days. Bottom line: good location, great service. I'm coming back and recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, VERY ACCOMODATING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been staying at this location over 20 yrs. Had to stay elsewhere when the original property burnt down and hated that...but this location has always been so accomodating, staff excellent. Excellent breakfast, service...I'm disabled and see doctors near this hotel. This hotel always helps me get to appointments, and sees that my stay is as easy and comfortable as possible. Staff goes out of their way to see everything we need is perfect. Manager is also especially nice...desk clerks, maintenance, van driver all outstanding! Never had any problems there whatsoever and couldn't imagine ever staying any place else! They all really seem to care about their guests. Staying there again in April. Always look forward to my stay there, even though the trip itself is very long and difficult. We always travel with our pets who are therapy/service dogs. They are very well behaved, well mannered and quite. We always take the bedspreads off the beds and replace them with our own bedding for our dogs to sleep on with us. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: La Quinta...spanish for.."you get what you pay for". Prior to booking a room for our apartment hunting trip, I called and spoke with them about the free internet. They said I wouldn't need to purchase an ethernet cable as they would be available and provided at no charge. I really needed access to my computer the day we arrived, but they told me they ran out of cables because people kept stealing them. The staff told me they would find one for us "no problem". Later that evening I spoke with them again and told them how important it was to me. They told me they couldn't do anything about it, and that it "wasn't their problem". I gave up and decided to go to bed and speak with the manager in the morning. Somehow through the night I managed to contract pink eye. Now I'm not saying I'm 100% sure that it came from my bed linens. However, I went to bed without any problems and I woke up with a swollen, bright red, itchy case of pink-eye.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th time to stay at this property and I cannot say enough good things about it: Friendly Staff, Great breakfast, excellent location, comfy beds, and clean, contemporary decor!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: LauraGuth
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend in Dallas and stayed at this hotel. I was very pleased. The location is great (right on HW 75, a few miles south of I-635) and accessible to just about everything: downtown, malls, resturants, Love Field, and a 20 minute or so drive to DFW. Rooms were very clean and spacious. I would request the king rooms/suites as they have a mini refrigerator and a microwave. The double rooms have 2 full size beds (which seem tiny when you're used to a queen). Pets are allowed with no deposit or extra fee, which was great for us since my yorkie is pretty much my child. They serve a continental breakfast which had plenty to choose from, waffles, bagels, muffins, fruit, cereal, etc. Pool was open til midnight. When I return to Dallas on a weekend trip I will definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: PhD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate - the non smoking room truly non smoking - a lit cigarette has never entered the door. The size and layout very comfortable. Free breakfast was equivalent to a $10.00 or more layout at a higher price hotel - only difference is that you had to microwave your own kolache, warm up your own boiled egg, and cook your own waffle. Cut fruit was very fresh. Again, a total atmosphere of cleanliness and freshness. Lobby was very pleasant to eat in. The staff was very considerate and courteous. As a woman, traveling alone, I felt safer here than in many hotels three times the price. The location is very convenient to downtown - took me approx. 20 minutes in peak traffic to arrive at the convention center door! The major differences I perceived in this hotel and a higher rated one are the quality of towels and bathroom products. That is not worth an extra $100.00+ a night to me. With the price difference, I can buy and bring my own products. A multitude of gold stars for LaQuinta and their staff!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Rest Stop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutley loved the La Quinta. After driving 23 hours to Dallas in a Penske truck I sure most anything would have been great but this was better than we could have expected. It was pleasent upon entering the Lobby and the rooms were clean and well kept. The complementary breakfast was great as well. It was wonderful sitting outside on the patio enjoying our breakfast in the morning and we are eager to return soon. Definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location on the service road along the highway. The rooms are nice for the business traveler. There is high speed internet access in every room. The hotel is also equipt with a small gym and heated pool and spa. The rates were very reasonable on hotels. I would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and comfortable. Our room was very large, clean and had comfortable beds. The comp. breakfast was great and very fresh. Front desk staff was very accomodating and friendly. The location is great(right off 75, and just up the street form northpark mall), and I will definently stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Dallas North Central
HotelInfo.Address: 10001 North Central Expressway, Highway 75, Dallas, TX 75231-4103
